p: During previous outbreaks, age over 50 and female sex were shown to be the main risk factors for chronic chikungunya disease [ 6, 32, 34, 40, 41, 48, 49]. Some studies focusing on gender have suggested that the menstrual cycle [ 50] and ovulation influence the production of pro‚Äêinflammatory cytokines by monocytes [ 50, 51] and that estradiol plays a role in the increase of antibody production [ 52, 53]. However, these hypotheses have not been fully tested.
